trans-unit.source: Implements an accessible object that <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> classes use to adjust the designer user interface for users who have impairments.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject"></xref> class by using the specified <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> which to apply the accessible object.
Gets the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> to which the accessible object is applied.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> to which the accessibility object is applied.
Gets the location and size of the accessible object.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the bounds of the accessible object.
Gets a string that describes the default action of the activity designer.
This property is displayed on the designer surface for users with impairments.
Not all activity designers have a default action.
A description of the default action associated with the activity designer, or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if the object has no default action.
Gets a string that describes the visual appearance of the activity designer.
This property is displayed on the designer surface for users with impairments.
Not all activity designers have a description.
A description of the activity designer's visual appearance, or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if the object has no description.
Performs the default action associated with the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject"></xref>.
Clients can retrieve the designer's default action by using <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject.DefaultAction%2A>.
Returns the service defined by the specified type that is associated with the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref>.
The service <xref href="System.Type"></xref> to request.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the requested service, or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if the service cannot be resolved.
Gets a description of what the activity associated with the activity designer does or how it is used.
A string that contains the description of what the activity associated with the activity designer does or how it is used, or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if no help is defined.

Gets or sets the name of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> associated with the accessible object's <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject.Name%2A> property is a string used by clients to identify, find, or announce an activity for the user.
To access the name of a child activity, you must first call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject.GetChild%2A> with the index of the name of the child activity you are retrieving.
You cannot perform a set operation on <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject.Name%2A>.
The name of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if the property has not been set.
Returns the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> associated with the location defined by the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation"></xref> values.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> at the specified location.
Gets the parent of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> that represents the parent of the current <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject"></xref> or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if there it no parent accessible object.
Gets the role of the current <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject"></xref>.
A graphical image used to diagram data can be obtained using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole.Diagram> member of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole"></xref> values, or <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole.None"></xref> if no role has been specified.
Modifies the selection or moves the keyboard focus of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleSelection"></xref> values.
Gets the accessible state of the current <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject"></xref>.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerAccessibleObject.State%2A> has the following possible values:

<xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Selected>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Selectable>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.MultiSelectable>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Focused>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Focusable>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.ReadOnly>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Moveable>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Invisible>.
A combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates"></xref> values.
